title: Supports who refuse to buy sightstone why do you do it? What makes you think Damage > Vision?
body: I am seriously curious! I want to hear your reasoning.

replies.body:
I always buy sightstone, but in the back of my mind I "feel" like not doing it.

I'll be honest with you, as a support main, that being forced to buy sightstone isn't fun. The utility is amazing, the price is reasonable, and it's the core of every victory and your contribution, but it doesn't feel good.

The support role has to buy sightstone. No other role has that as a mandatory feature, not even the jungler (who, in theory, can benefit from it. I know pros do that on occasion, but I don't watch much LCS). Even though the sightstone has multiple upgrades, it is *the* constant among the support class. Even the ADC class (granted, before the marksman rework it was basically IE rush and maybe BORK for Vayne/Twitch) has more building diversity. 

Part of the game is dynamic builds. Cookie cutter builds aren't always the best way to play the game, and some of the strategy is in counterbuilding your opponent. As the lowest income class, rushing my first 800 lane gold into sightstone doesn't "feel" fun. 

Another factor that contributes to my feeling is a bit of spite, and how I feel that the game's state shouldn't be at a point where sightstone is *needed.* Vision should be 20/20/20/20/20, but a lot of the time I feel like it's 15/20/10/5/45. 

ANother thing that makes me feel a bit spiteful is that people will report you for not buying sightstone, but it takes huge amounts of effort to get them to buy a pink ward, and for some people to even use their trinket. No joke, I've had people force me to buy sightstone on a bad day (normals, mind you) but put down three wards themselves in one game.

Now, this is only how I feel. How I feel and how I act are two different things, and I highly doubt that most support mains feel this way. I want my role to be defined by the champions, not a single iconic item to the point that several memes, campaigns, and wallpapers represent the support role with a ward. 

Again, this is just my opinion.

This is a very well-thought out answer, and it's nice to see the opposite side of things from a fellow support main.  I view this issue slightly differently, though, and in this case I think it's mostly just a difference in playstyle more than anything.

I absolutely think that the support isn't just there to ward shit you're too lazy for.  As a Soraka main, I'm far too unsafe and squishy to be placing wards anywhere the enemy might be at the moment, because if I get caught out on my own it's an easy kill for the enemy unless they fuck up.  I expect my team to ward as much as they can and often ping bushes when my trinket is down/sightstone is empty to ask one of my allies to ward it.  That being said, in the end, I play support not to do damage and carry the game myself, but to help my allies carry the game.  I'm already building a lot of utility items to assist my team, so why not build one that helps them in less tangible, but equally important ways.  On top of which, Ruby Sightstone synergizes well with my typical support builds, so why not buy it?

Do I think people rely too much on their support for vision at the moment and are too uptight about supports not buying sightstone?  Absolutely.  The trinkets were introduced to give you a nice way to ward your lane and place wards throughout the game, and you should take advantage of this nice resource you're given as much as possible.  But at the same time, when push comes to shove I'm the one who can most afford to be caught out, most afford to miss a skirmish, and most afford to be gone for a little while, so I'm going to carry more of the warding duties on myself because of it.

>As a Soraka main, I'm far too unsafe and squishy to be placing wards anywhere the enemy might be at the moment, because if I get caught out on my own it's an easy kill for the enemy unless they fuck up.

You know, this reminds me of something: I really hope Rito eventually takes Bard's concept and try to improve that fantasy, and make a support champion designed to scout and interact with vision (which some ADC's do, like Quinn and Kalista) while sacrificing damage, cc, and/or other utility to do so.

> I feel that the game's state shouldn't be at a point where sightstone is needed.

I could not agree more. It would be so nice if vision wasn't a needed thing, more like something that you can get for strategy, at the very least get it to where anyone can be the designated warder and you pick who that will be based on strategy rather that "Who needs damage the least". 
I just came up with an idea for ward boots that I think would solve a lot of issues (if not raise a few at the same time), but at the end of the day it wouldn't make vision LESS necessary, just make free vision available to everyone without sacrificing other items (aside from boots of course).

>ANother thing that makes me feel a bit spiteful is that people will report you for not buying sightstone

This is one of my biggest issues with the ward/support issue. It pretty much enforces the idea of "if support doesn't take sightstone, report them". You don't have that issue with ADC, Top or Mid. You might have that issue with Jungle, but that can just be an honest mistake if they forget to take {{summoner:11}}. But if Support doesn't take {{item:2049}} then it's free game to report them.

>just make free vision available to everyone

We already have that in the game, it looks like this:

{{item:3340}}

Unfortunately, Riot nerfed the hell out of it because everyone was taking it over red and blue trinkets. Back then, it was basically a sightstone without the HP and free to purchase right at the start of the game. And for some reason, Riot thought that it was a _bad_ thing when supports could just pick up their trinket and forgo a sightstone.

Here's my solution. Remove sightstone from the game, buff the yellow trinket to cover for it's loss.

Yes, the yellow trinket might crowd out the other alternatives, but that's a much better (and more easily fixable) problem to have than supports feeling forced to buy an item they don't feel good buying.

> The support role has to buy sightstone. No other role has that as a mandatory feature, not even the jungler [...] Even the ADC class [...] has more building diversity. 

You can't compare a 800 gold item to a full complete item. As a Support, you basically always spend your first 1300g for Gold item tier 2 + Sightstone, but an ADC basically always spend it on a BF Sword, and a Jungler on Jungler's item tier 2 + enchant. 

I won't lie, build diversity for Supports is bad, but it's more an issue of having less total gold and being almost forced to buy Gold item + Stone + Aegis than just the Stone in itself and the fact you're responsible for Vision. It's not just being forced to build an 800g item, it's being forced to spend 50 or 60% of your reduced income and half your item slots on various items for the team before even considering luxury items for yourself.

> Vision should be 20/20/20/20/20, but a lot of the time I feel like it's 15/20/10/5/45. 

Well, that's kinda ridiculous. Damage isn't 20/20/20/20/20 either, and Tanking isn't an equal share either. The problem is, dealing damage is *fun* (or at least, *seen* as more fun by a large part of the community) so the people responsible for more than 20% of the damage don't complain, and hoard all the glory, but no single task in this game is equally shared by all players. Specialization is more efficient, and also enables Champion designs to be more original and diverse.

>Specialization is more efficient, and also enables Champion designs to be more original and diverse.

Very true, but we're talking about an item and not champion kits. Soraka, with equal AP, will never deal as much damage as Karthus, but Karthus will never heal as much as Soraka. That's a given, that's champion design diversity.

Vision, on the other hand, has the capability of being *close* to 20/20/20/20/20, but Riot's not really pushing it beyond the trinkets.

You're missing my point, it's not a question of kits being better suited for one thing or the other, it's a question of roles in a team being clearly separated: you wouldn't want a team full of Assassins without any DPS champ. The carry has to deal damage, the Tank has to tank, etc. And nobody is asking the carry to tank sh*t, because if he played and built in order to tank, the slight increase in tankyness wouldn't be worth the decrease in damage.

Vision is just the same as damage and durability: it's better if one person heavily invest into it and if the other players don't have to divert resources from their main task. Of course, Riot could push for Vision being a shared task, just as they could push for durability being more homogeneous among different champs, but why Vision should be treated as a different thing than all other tasks?

>but why Vision should be treated as a different thing than all other tasks?

Because supports should be defined by their utility: the heals, shields, the crowd control. The the other classes can do some of that, but the supports are defined by their utility. 

If sightstone was deleted, hypothetically, vision would be a shared task and supports would still have their dedicated spot on the team. Every class has its defensive, offensive, and sometimes hybrid/dueling items, and I really, personally feel that there should be vision items for every class akin to the trinket. Sightstone is a godsend, but I really feel that vision should be looked into a bit more. Someone suggested they could be the new boot enchantments, and blah blah blah.

I understand your point of view, but I disagree, and my reasons are two-fold.

The first one is more or less objective: you're confusing Support as a position, and "supportive" Champions. Sightstone is expected from the Support position, not from the supportive classes of champions. A Nautilus support is expected to build a Sightstone, a Nautilus top isn't. Same for Annie mid versus sup. The other way around, a Lulu/Morgana going mid isn't a "Support", and isn't expected to build a Sightstone. So Support as a position isn't at all defined by heal/shield/CC. The definition of Support (as a position) is, literally, it's not a joke, "the guy without gold".

The second one is much more subjective: I really think that Vision should be a specialized task that is assigned (mostly) to a single player. Of course you can disagree with that, and then there is no point going further, but if you agree that it makes sense to give this responsibility to a single person, then it's logical to give it to "the guy without gold". He's not expected to build a lot of selfish items and to fill his inventory anyway (he doesn't have the income to afford it), so he can put a little gold in a very non-slot efficient item that will help the team more than him directly.

>So Support as a position isn't at all defined by heal/shield/CC. The definition of Support (as a position) is, literally, it's not a joke, "the guy without gold".

This is my problem right here. You know what's the worst part?

You're absolutely right.

I know full damn well that's what my main job is. ANd it sucks. As a support main, I want to be defined by heals/shields/CC, but it's damn vision. And I wish Rito would work on that.

This is why I hate sightstone, yet build it every game. I play my support champions decently, and make plays and saves, but at the end of the day people are still going to enter every game and see me as a ward bot. And that ~~fucking~~ sucks.

Well, there are many layers on this issue, but one thing is: there are only 4 sources of incomes (3 lanes + jungle) and 5 players in a team, so you have to have a player without income. That's the only "hard" constraint. Now, what the job of this guy without income should be, that's open to debate. Currently (and as far as I know, always in LoL), the meta says "vision and team utility", but it could evolve, like with roaming supports like Bard.

But if you want to be defined by your heals/shields/CC, you don't have to play Support, you can go mid or top with Oriana, Morgana, Lulu, etc. (I shouldn't say that given the current lack of supports, but meh...).

The only time I_ temporarily_ forfeit a sightstone is when I have 900 gold (thus being able to purchase mobility boots) and I know for a fact that the added mobility will help me not only secure a kill for my midlaner, but also take down a mid lane turret. Sometimes my mid laner's opponent overextends and I know that our jungler alone (although might be able to secure the kill) wouldn't feel as determined to try to take down that mid turret. With me there, not only would I assist in the kill, I also would be a third person that would make pushing down that first mid turret faster. By then I'd easily have 800 gold, return to base, and purchase my sightstone.

Delaying SS is fine. Skipping it not so much. At some point map will open and vision will be more and more valuable. Until then, yeap SS can be delayed if you can make a difference with other items. After all Allistar gangs at mid are deadly. Specially along/after the jungler ganged. Poor midlaner.
There is a reason alistar has his own brand name for ganks.

Basically:

If their jungle is in the game, I'll buy one.
If their support buys one, I'll buy one.
If their support skips it and jungle doesn't connect, I'll typically delay it, but if we're dominant that game I may skip it entirely.

Oops, I forgot the reasoning.
So in the scenario that I end up delaying or skipping sightstone is because the enemy support isn't placing enough wards to warrant a sweeper, and he likely won't have a sweeper to clear mine out.  Since we're dominant in the game our minions give us a good track of where the enemy is going (if support roams mid, we'll more than likely see him leave from his inner turret in bot.)

the extra 800g isn't that important, so I usually pick it up anyways.  When my team is already 17-4 and I feel they may just surrender, I just...don't care.
